page.title: 05Warwick Crown Court.
page.content: Justice has been dispensed in Warwick since the 15th Century and in a building called Shire Hall since 1571.This early building was replaced in 1676 and again in 1758 when the earlier building became inadequate.A bodyguard for the Judges was provided by the sheriffs but in 1890 the police took over this duty.We have looked at the duties of one Court official, an usher.The usher's duty is to assist as much as possible all people attending court especially jurors and witnesses and to contribute to the smooth running of the court. They obtain the names of barristers engaged in the trials, escort the Judges to and from the courts, administer oaths to witness and to police officers and ensure that neccessary stationery is supplied to the jury, and others..
